page.title: 04 TRADITIONAL RHYMES
page.content: We are a class of four and five year olds in our first year in school. We like to sing and do action rhymes together. We have talked about our Nursery Rhymes and have chosen our favourites. They are:_ Baa baa black sheep,Have you any wool? Yes,Sir.Yes,Sir.Three bags full. One for the master.One for the dame, And one for the little boy who lives down the lane. Jack and Jill went up the hill, To fetch a pail of water. Jack fell down and broke his crown, And Jill came tumbling after. We sing these rhymes at home and in school.
